results.title: Cyberthon Archives [documentation]
results.brief_description: Cyberthon was a series of TV broadcast events initiated in the 1990’s in Melbourne, Australia. This collection contains photographs, images and documentation that accompany the moving content in the archive.

results.title: My best friend's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Ronald Bass, Jerry Zucker and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Julia Roberts stars in this hilarious tale of lovelorn food critic Julianne, who discovers she wants to spend the rest of her life with her best friend the day he pops the question to someone else. She has four days to break up the wedding and help her best friend discover that she’s the one. With an outstanding supporting cast including Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett, this film takes the cake as the romantic comedy of the year.

results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.

results.title: Cyberpunk
results.creator_credit: Marianne Trench, Peter Von Brandenburg and Intercon Productions
results.brief_description: The term ‘Cyberpunk’ was first used to describe a new genre of science fiction literature, inaugurated by the publication of William Gibson’s book ‘Neuromancer’. A self confessed computer illiterate, Gibson’s visions began shaping the way people thought and spoke about future technologies. This program examines the concepts central to the Cyberpunk movement and interviews Cyberpunks, young people determined to use technology against those who would otherwise control that technology. The program covers computer animation, hacking and piracy, Virtual Reality and various technologies that have emerged or are being developed, influenced by Gibson’s literary visions.

results.title: It's Your Art
results.brief_description: This video introduces the art collection of the Australian National Gallery, Canberra, which houses over 86,000 works of Australian and international art. While exploring the diversity of the National Collection, the video also investigates the relationships between various works on display. The Gallery’s outstanding collection of Australian art and its important contemporary works provide the focus of the video, which presents an informative and stimulating guide to ways of viewing the collection and understanding the role of the gallery.

results.title: It's snow
results.creator_credit: Gayle Thomas and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Color cut-out animation inspired by the shape of snowflakes and touched with the airy magic of these fragile designs. While music tinkles invitingly, snowflakes roll and whirl, pulse and glitter, shining with the many hues of twinkling lights. Made without words, this is a joyous film to please the fancy and captivate eye and ear.

results.title: Mischief
results.creator_credit: Ian Shand, Jack Grossman and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: At a village pony auction a Davey misses out on buying a pony which was purchased by the owner of a pony trekking stable. He gets a job at the stable looking after the pony ‘Mischief’ leading to the jealousy of other stable hands and his eventual wrongful sacking. When another young boy visiting the stable is thrown from the pony onto a quarry ledge, Davey and ‘Mischief’ try to rescue him before blasting commences at the quarry. Stars: Paul Frazer, Iain Burton, Adrianne Byrne, Michael Newport, Gina Malcolm, Gerald Sim, Colin Gordon, Bill Owen, Frieda Knorr, Charles Rea, Peter Porteous, Deidre Benner and Gerald Williams.

results.title: Mars attacks the world
results.creator_credit: Robert F Hill, Ford Beebe, Barney A Sarecky and Filmcraft Production
results.brief_description: Based on Alex Raymond’s newspaper feature “Flash Gordon” and the serial “Flash Gordon’s trip to Mars”, this condensed version of the serial provides a fascinating historical look into the sci-fi films of the past, minus all the special effects and computer animation of today’s blockbuster sci-fi films. The story revolves around the universal theme of good vs evil, of enemy planets trying to destroy Earth. When strange unexplained phenomena start occuring on Earth, Flash Gordon (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dr Zarkov (Frank Shannon) and Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) jump to the rescue and take a space flight to Mars, crash-landing in the Valley of Desolation. There Flash runs into his old enemy Ming the Merciless of Planet Mongo, and Ming’s ally, Queen Azura of Mars, whose attempts to destroy Earth with a deadly ray are eventually thwarted by Flash and his companions with the help of The Clay King and his Clay Men. Flash, Dale and Dr Zarkov return to Earth to a hero’s welcome, ticker-tape parade and all. Cast also includes Charles Middleton, Beatrice Roberts, Donald Kerr, Richard Alexander. NB: “Due to unique material contained herein, fluctuations may occur in picture and sound quality.”
